radiographic_examinations.findings: Lower Thorax: Bibasilar atelectasis noted. Liver: Hepatic steatosis without fat fraction of 13.5%. A 6 mm focus of arterial enhancement at the inferior right lobe of the liver. Mild dilatation of the proximal intrahepatic bile ducts. Biliary: The common bile duct is mildly dilated, measuring 8 mm. Gallbladder is surgically absent. Pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, and kidneys are normal with no concerning lesions. Gastrointestinal tract is unremarkable. No lymphadenopathy and abdominal aorta is not aneurysmal. No concerning osseous lesions or notable soft tissue abnormality.
